title: The numerical sets
descript: The numerical sets used in basic mathematics are: Natural (N), integers (Z), rational (Q), irrational (Q), real (R) and complex (C).

title: The numerical sets
descript: The numerical sets used in basic mathematics are: Natural (N), integers (Z), rational (Q), irrational (Q), real (R) and complex (C).

title: Set of natural numbers
descript: Is denoted by N = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, …}. The first natural number is one and the progression continues arithmetically by adding one to each new value.

title: Set of natural numbers
descript: Is denoted by N = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, …}. The first natural number is one and the progression continues arithmetically by adding one to each new value.

title: Set of integers
descript: The set of integers, which we represent as Z, is the set formed by positive and negative numbers.

title: Set of integers
descript: The set of integers, which we represent as Z, is the set formed by positive and negative numbers.

title: Set of rational numbers
descript: Any number that can be represented as the quotient of two integers is called a rational number.

title: Set of rational numbers
descript: Any number that can be represented as the quotient of two integers is called a rational number.

title: Set of irrational numbers
descript: They are all those decimals with infinite figures that cannot be expressed as a fraction.

title: Set of irrational numbers
descript: They are all those decimals with infinite figures that cannot be expressed as a fraction.

title: Set of real numbers
descript: It is made up of other numbers such as natural, integer, rational and irrational numbers. Real numbers are infinite and follow an order, and can be decimal and negative.
